U: S. Senator Tammy Baldwin's claim that Republicans are "organizing to take people's health care away" was made in a January 6, 2017 interview with Wisconsin Public Television.
The claim specifically refers to the pla: ACA), also known as Obamacare, which was a key legislation in providing health care coverage.
The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Off: CBO) reported in January 2017 that if key portions of the ACA were repealed, 18 million people would be uninsured within a year, and this number could grow to 32 million by 2026.
Prominent Republicans: including President Donald Trump and U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan, have stated their intention to replace the ACA with alternative legislation that aims to provide access to affordable and sustainable health care for all Americans.
